content.label: Total money grab by some crap team that bought the rights to classic game. Shame on you
Great when I can open it up and load my old game.... Lame, don’t buy.
While I’m optimistic there’s deep systems and mechanics here, a broken/unplayable tutorial paired with a pay-to-play feels disingenuous at best.

Since I downloaded this game, the best of the genre, IMHO, I’ve actually completely forgotten what the original x-com even looked like. This game had become my new standard. Love it! 
Idk if it’s an Easter egg but I’ve been able to exploit a ‘glitch’ regarding infinite grenades. No apparent limit. Works with all grenades and when I research the alien grenade, I’m able to exploit that too. I can then stock up on a thousand of them and sell them back.  For !$!$!$

Game locks up when you try to select the very first mission (Back To Roswell). Can’t bring myself to lower my rating though. So happy it’s back in the App Store. Please fix bug and I’ll even buy some in-game currency because you guys are awesome.

Awesome game, i grew up on xcom terror from the deep and its required 8mb of ram this is the closest you’re going to get

save this code: you'll need to decipher it: 21:15D7BFFC

Buyer be ware!!! This game is unplayable and freezes when you attempt to play! Also the game only plays in one third of the screen! Worst purchase ever and I had to contact customer support to get a refund for this trash!
Relived by teen years of playing X-Com. Plays great on the iPad, and its just the right amount of difficulty. Edit: Now it's list another crap-filled micro-transaction game.
Nuff said
This is great reminds me of the original xcom

Was looking for the original or a version of it for the iPad, this falls way short both in graphics and gameplay. It's much shorter than the original and lacks almost everything that made the first game fun, it's just a cheap ripoff
Having earned my stripes in the origins of turn based strategy games such as XCOM, Jagged Alliance, and such I speak with much experience. This is a good mobile version of a timeless classic.
Lame game can't request on refund on website due to it not loading properly on my iPad. Please refund
Stop the greed.  Do not support IAP.
Just like xcom and pretty difficult too
If you liked xcom you will like this. Haven't played to far in yet but I think the original xcom is better obviously

This game will give you the feel of the original x-com, but it lacks the polish and is a great work in progress. I commend the author for their efforts and hope that they continue to engineer the depth and polish that could make this 3-star fun game into a 5-star must have.  I hope they keep at it and the project doesn't fester like most things on the App Store.

title.label: Finally a real game for my phone

content.label: Great game. A few things from the original xcom I miss, but lots of fun and very well executed.

You simply can't finish this game without need of purchase gadgets that cost money. Anything with micro transactions are not worth a star, specially when game itself cost money. I wish i didn't spend my money for that. game is playable for couple of hours only. after that you will run out of game funds, and game becomes a storage hog unless you decide to fork out more cash.

The tech tree is to small and the ending a bit anticlimactic. The graphics and some of the gameplay has been simplified, but it's still fun to kill aliens, do an autopsy on them, and then sell their corpse for money!  Do the under water one next! :-)
I played the original X-com and find that this is as much fun, and it's great to be able to play it anywhere on the iPad mini..!
Not worth the 3 bucks. Can only play the campaign for 6 months(game time) before it says you lost funding and shuts you down.
I do videos on this game, look up kingdamon2107.
Fun, suspenseful, open framework, good balance.  Nice game

I was so excited to find this game since I was feeling nostalgic for the original X-COM game. And this is a good fun imitation that works fairly well on my IPad.  However, it's a little buggy, with bad physics programming in many situations (try standing up and throwing a grenade over a waist-high picket fence). 

The biggest shortcoming, though, is that it just isn't as deep as the original. The old PC game was spooky and scary due to the plot (when the aliens start abducting your marines and playing mind control games on them, for example), but even the 2.0 version of AvH doesn't really have a plot. It's just one fight after another, with no sense that the aliens are improving at the same time the humans are. 

I still enjoyed it quite a bit and recommend this game. But it's very shallow.
This is one addictive app!  I've really enjoyed the Onslaught update that really has the feel of the old x-com game. If you liked x-com you will love AvH.

This is lacking in some aspects of XCOM UFO Defense, such as air combat, base assaults, terror missions with civvies running around, some grenade features, but for the most part it's a pretty good port for the low price. They are working on another related version with multiplayer (I'm in the beta), and that is quite a lot of fun too.

This game feels like the original X-Com from 1994, and I am having a blast playing it. I'm not entirely sure how much of my enjoyment of this game is due to nostalgia, but I don't care. The turn-based combat is brutal - especially when compared to titles with a more modern aesthetic. But surviving those difficult battles is part of the fun. I definitely recommend this game.
It's OK, but I would like resilient armor to not be made out of mech corpses(IT'S REALLY ANNOYING WHEN YOU HAVE TO FACE ONE-SHOT-ONE-KILL PLASMA AND ENERGY WEAPONRY).
I would like to see interceptions, enemy bases and Xcom base deffence. I would also like to see more enemy types and facilities the game enemies are also way more powerful than your troops.
Great game from my younger days. Love it.

While this is not the original, it is as close as we will ever get as Firaxis may not be able, or willing for that matter, to port X-COM:UFO Defense to the iOS.

Changes needed made:

Ability to demolish rooms from base
Ability to load research without scientists

More to follow as I play more.
Save your money and buy xcom.

If I didn't know  better I would say this game was created by microprose themselves. The art design of the aliens is not as unique as the original, but the game plays exactly like the original game we all loved. 

It's a shame how underrated this game is, it truly is masterpiece of fandom and I am grateful for the dedication the developer put into providing us with this nostalgic experiance  on the mobile  platform.

title.label: Classic X-Com in All It's Glorious Glory

content.label:
I loved the game as a kid.  This game is everything I had hoped. Including the nearly iPad Throw inducing random critical hit from an alien smugly hiding in the shadows (you can see the smug on his green, featureless face).  Who can forget being gunned down by friendly fire as Kilwoski  finally snaps and rage-quits your squad while yelling "Game Over Man! Game Over!"

Ok, the game is retro in appearance, however the gameplay is every bit the equal of, and likely surpasses, it's modern counterparts.

Just game (no IAP at the time of this review), and I keep coming back to, second only to Star Base Orion, in my go-to library. 

Wonderful game. Responsive company.

title.label: Close to XCom but far less enjoyable

content.label:
Summary: This game would really be great if the peons weren't instagib supersnipers and the enemies were more thoughtfully conceptualized. 

This game is so close to XCom you're better off reading a review on that to get the gist of how it plays. The developers surely worked their tails off making it. But they really failed in making it a fun game. 

The enemies aren't interesting at all; they are generally homologues to your own troops. The one unique enemy, the lowest tier as well: a slimeball that slings acid blobs at you, is incredibly accurate at range and quickly upgrades to an instakill weapon. 

While the mechanics are there for a good XCOM clone, the theme and immersion fall very short.

Before the IOS port Release of Xcom
This was THE only Xcom type game available in the App Store.

Loving crafted by a two person Husband-Wife team, this games only real shortcoming is the lack of attention it's received. Having been regularly updated  with content for over two years so far, AvH is a true gem for anyone who loves classic Xcom.

I purchased this a long time ago and am still loving it. Replay value is great. Nostalgic value is great. Support by the tiny development team is great. My only complaint would be that the latest update requires a different iOS from the one when I purchased AvH. But I can and will continue to play the previous version for a long time.
Great game, great app support/updates

Aliens can shoot through walls, you can't. Throwing grenades is a coin flip. You can be out in open fields (no obstruction in any height level) and the grenade might drop right in front of you (even for the most accurate soldiers). You shoot an alien in the back, he shoots you back instantly and kills you. Many other annoying details like this during combat, that make the constant saving and loading unavoidable.Non-combat aspects of the game are great.
I've not played X-COM before (shame on me), but so far this is incredibly fun, challenging, and tense.

As another nostalgic Xcom fan, this is a great turn based strategy game and best I've played on the iPad. Very true to the original in form and function with some depth lacking (such as crashed ufos, base raids, etc) but future updates look like they will add that.  I've already sunk 20hrs and still going.  Controls are better than I expected with only minor issues selecting tiles immediately behind the character.  Only small, small complaint is some line of fire quirks in which aliens can fire at you but you can't fire back.  This is a top 3 app for me.  Now if you guys could port over star control 2.......

If you were looking for the classic xcom game find something else. I can see how they were trying to recreate some of the fun parts of the game, and the graphics help add to the fun, but if falls apart in the details. The guns/ammo/equipment aspect is completely watered down. Encounters are simplified. This game just generally lacks depth.

title.label: Perfectly captures the feel of X-com

content.label:
A great little tactical combat game that just gets better with each release.  Here's hoping ESP and fighters are in the works as well!

Edit: after more play time, I'm still very pleased but have some requests:
- more strategic mission types, like "prevent destruction of a strategic resource" (oil field mission), "save the civilians for more funds/researchers/engineers", etc.  Currently there's no reason not to trash the town during a mission.
- Better LOS code for multi-level missions.  Currently it's very easy to see enemies when LOS passes exactly between two wall tiles on different levels, but *shooting* is still impossible. Do I have LOS or don't I?
- Auto-save when the game is unloaded by the OS.  Holy *Jesus* is it frustrating to use a couple other apps and come back to the game to find the opening screen instead of my mostly-completed mission.  I know this is possible; other games do it all the time.  Please!  Seriously, I'm begging.

Otherwise, a fantastic game.  Great work!

X-COM revived!  First strategy game I ever played and it still has me wanting more! 
Great Job, peeps!
The only complaint I would even nod towards is that sometimes hitting your target is a act of divine intervention.  Otherwise a quick to learn and love game just like the original.
The game is great when it works, but half of the time it doesn't even recognize the touch commands–even in a menu. That needs to be fixed.
This I so close to Xcom it's amazing.  In love with this game. No glitches after a weak.  Save often, even newb setting is hard!

This game is awesome! Its been pretty close to exactly like the original for me so far. I just hope I can get to do the part I loved most about the original. I loved having the psych power to control the aliens with your mind then you could just walk them around killing each other. Loved that so I hope it's still in this game. But so far so good for me.
Addicted
